chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Trammell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 147 days credit.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence currently serving

Defendant Robert L Trammell in court, in custody, via video with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing. Defense addresses the affidavits from the two victims. Defense is not contesting the restitution. Court orders restitution of $3608.58 to be paid to Russ Darrow Group and $9,290.10 to be paid to Lynch Horter Chevrolet. Amended JOC to be prepared.
in support of restitution filed.

To place detainer filed by the jail.  
The Case is closed and is set for restitution hearing.  Defendant to appear by video for hearing.  
Detainer not necessary.
Associated with Charge #1
Restitution hearing on August 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert L Trammell in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Read-in List filed by State.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Defense requests a restitution hearing. Court sets a restitution hearing. Defendant to appear by video. If defendant can not be located, Defense states they will waive his appearance at the restitution hearing. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years - 147 days credit, Extended Supervision: 3 years) - consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving now. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No contact with any Russ Darrow or Lynch Hoarder Chevrolet.   DNA, surcharge is waived.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
